Package sketch.compiler.ast.core.stmts

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Statement
    A generic statement, as created in the front-end.
    StmtAssert
    An assert statement.
    StmtAssign
    A statement that assigns a value to an expression.
    StmtAssume
    An assert statement.
    StmtAtomicBlock Deprecated 
    StmtBlock
    A block of statements executed in sequence.
    StmtBreak Deprecated 
    StmtContinue Deprecated 
    StmtDoWhile
    A standard do-while loop.
    StmtEmpty
    An empty statement.
    StmtExpr
    A statement containing only an expression.
    StmtFor
    A C-style for loop.
    StmtFunDecl
    This is used to define a function inside the scope of a function.
    StmtIfThen
    A standard conditional statement.
    StmtImplicitVarDecl Deprecated 
    StmtInsertBlock
    Represents the sugar construct: insert S into { s1; s2; ...; sn; } The semantics of this construct is to execute S at exactly one of the following points, chosen nondeterministically: 0.
    StmtLoop
    A loop that executes its body a specified number of times, the "repeat(n) stmt" construct, where "n" must be a compile-time constant, but that constant can be some expression with unknown choices like a hole "??".
    StmtMinimize
    The minimize statement, to tell the backend that some integer value needs to be minimized.
    StmtMinLoop
    A loop that executes its body a specified number of times like the StmtLoop, but the backend will make sure the body is executed for a minimal number of times.
    StmtReorderBlock
    The "reorder{ statements }" construct executes a list of statements in some unknown order, and the Sketch Solver will resolve the correct order to satisfy the constraints.
    StmtReturn
    A return statement with an optional value.
    StmtSpAssert  
    StmtSwitch  
    StmtVarDecl
    A variable-declaration statement.
    StmtVarDecl.VarDeclEntry  
    StmtVarDecl.VarDeclEntryWithNames  
    StmtWhile
    A standard while loop.
